{{unknown}}

The post appeared first on Linux Today.

In this guide, we will discuss how to disable and remove unwanted services and packages on RHEL-based distributions such as Rocky Linux, AlmaLinux, and Fedora, ensuring that your system remains secure and functional.

The post How to Disable and Remove Unnecessary Services on Linux appeared first on Linux Today.
title: How to Disable and Remove Unnecessary Services on Linux

description:
Umami is a free and open-source web analytics platform written in Nodejs. In this guide, you’ll learn how to install Umami privacy-focused analytics on the Ubuntu 24.04 server.

The post How to Install Umami Privacy Analytics on Ubuntu 24.04 appeared first on Linux Today.
title: How to Install Umami Privacy Analytics on Ubuntu 24.04

description:
MINIX creator Andrew Tanenbaum receives the top Association for Computing Machinery (ACM) award for educational impact.

The post Andrew Tanenbaum Honored With ACM Software System Award appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Andrew Tanenbaum Honored With ACM Software System Award

description:
Highlights of Darktable 4.8 include a new color equalizer module to control hue, lightness, and saturation based on colors, two new modules to support image composition, namely Enlarge Canvas and Overlay, as well as a new a toggle for switching the darkroom mode, which forces the pixel-pipe processing to use the whole image data rather […]

The post Darktable 4.8 Open-Source Raw Image Editor Released, Here’s What’s New appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Darktable 4.8 Open-Source Raw Image Editor Released, Here’s What’s New

description:
Although Sunday will be the last day that CentOS 7 will be officially supported, you don’t have to move to something else right away. There are plenty of support services you can use to keep your workloads safe and secure until you’re ready to migrate.

The post No Need to Move From CentOS 7 by June 30 If You Have Aftermarket Support appeared first on Linux Today.
title: No Need to Move From CentOS 7 by June 30 If You Have Aftermarket Support

description:
Budgie 10.9.2 desktop environment enhancements include fixes for notifications, workspace applet, TabSwitcher, and more.

The post Budgie 10.9.2 Now Available, Improves Stability and Compatibility appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Budgie 10.9.2 Now Available, Improves Stability and Compatibility
